      • setStatus

        public VmHostRule.Builder setStatus(Status status)
        Flag to indicate whether or not the rule is currently satisfied.
        Parameters:

      • setEnabled

        public VmHostRule.Builder setEnabled(java.lang.Boolean enabled)
        Flag to indicate whether or not the rule is enabled. Set this property when user configures the rule. The default value is false (disabled). If there is a rule conflict, the Server can override the setting to disable a rule. If null or empty, the value is skipped.
        Parameters:
        enabled - New value for the property.

      • setInCompliance

        public VmHostRule.Builder setInCompliance(java.lang.Boolean inCompliance)
        Flag to indicate if the rule is in compliance. If null or empty, the value is skipped.
        Parameters:
        inCompliance - New value for the property.

      • setName

        public VmHostRule.Builder setName(java.lang.String name)
        Name of the rule.
        Parameters:
        name - New value for the property.

      • setMandatory

        public VmHostRule.Builder setMandatory(java.lang.Boolean mandatory)
        Flag to indicate whether compliance with this rule is mandatory or optional. The default value is false (optional). If null or empty, the value is skipped.
        Parameters:
        mandatory - New value for the property.

      • setUserCreated

        public VmHostRule.Builder setUserCreated(java.lang.Boolean userCreated)
        Flag to indicate whether the rule is created by the user or the system. If null or empty, the value is skipped.
        Parameters:
        userCreated - New value for the property.

      • setVmGroupName

        public VmHostRule.Builder setVmGroupName(java.lang.String vmGroupName)
        Virtual group name. If null or empty, the value is skipped.
        Parameters:
        vmGroupName - New value for the property.

      • setAffineHostGroupName

        public VmHostRule.Builder setAffineHostGroupName(java.lang.String affineHostGroupName)
        Name of the affine host group. The affine host group identifies hosts on which VmHotRule#vmGroupName virtual machines can be powered-on. If null or empty, the value is skipped.
        Parameters:
        affineHostGroupName - New value for the property.

      • setAntiAffineHostGroupName

        public VmHostRule.Builder setAntiAffineHostGroupName(java.lang.String antiAffineHostGroupName)
        Name of the anti-affine host group. The anti-affine host group identifies hosts on which VmHotRule#vmGroupName virtual machines should not be powered-on. If null or empty, the value is skipped.
        Parameters:
        antiAffineHostGroupName - New value for the property.

        public VmHostRule build()
